@katebevan About 1/4160000 the length of Wales.
@fishpercolator I like it. Seems to flow a lot better, I think.

@fishpercolator Playing more, I think itâ€™s the fact that they look like buttons, but seem to be obviously links, is whatâ€™s jarring. Iâ€™d not expect finger on a button in an SPA, for example, but if pressing goes to another page, I think brain expects finger. If that makes sense?

@fishpercolator Itâ€™s an odd one. I canâ€™t quite put my finger on it (I know, I knowâ€¦) but it feels inconstant. Iâ€™m still trying to work out exactly why. I think the pie-like menu doesnâ€™t help in that it does use a hand, but behaves like a menu/button.

@fishpercolator @pedantic_git Iâ€™m curious: some â€œlinksâ€ have a hand cursor, others a more traditional cursor. Deliberate design decision and, of so, why?
(I note some also have a â€œzoomâ€ cursor, but I can see the sense in that).
